scenes.title: Deleting Instagram, gaining focus
scenes.main_point: Removing Instagram freed time and attention for intentional reading.
scenes.scene_summary: After deleting Instagram, I found more time, energy, and attention to read intentionally.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person at home in a calm routine, holding a phone showing Instagram deleted.
They set the phone aside and read a book with focused attention.

scenes.title: Curiosity-led reading and Feynman’s warning
scenes.main_point: A simple daily reading quota led to ideas from Deutsch and Holiday, anchored by Feynman’s principle.
scenes.scene_summary: I read one hour daily, and Feynman’s warning hit: don’t fool yourself.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits at a desk at home, one-hour timer beside them, reading “The Beginning of Infinity” with “Ego is the Enemy” stacked nearby.
They pause and jot down “Don’t fool yourself — Richard Feynman” on a notepad, looking thoughtful.

scenes.title: How high ego fooled me
scenes.main_point: High ego distorted reality, blocked beginnerhood, and eased avoidance; low ego enabled growth.
scenes.scene_summary: High ego made me dodge beginner work, until rejection pushed me to learn and improve.
key_elements: Searching for purpose vs basic habits
Hackathons: finalist twice, third prize once
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A young adult sits with a guitar, tense and hesitant, while a confident kid demonstrates a simple chord.
In a small practice room, the adult watches and starts copying the basics, humbled but determined.

scenes.title: Bad explanations vs good explanations
scenes.main_point: Seeking good explanations through questions and humility prevented self-deception; ego needed management.
scenes.scene_summary: I questioned bad explanations, stayed humble about what I didn’t know, and managed ego deliberately.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A thoughtful narrator sits at a desk with open books labeled “Deutsch,” “Religion/Authority,” and “Galileo,” writing questions on a page.
Behind them, a small Earth speck floats in a vast universe sketch, implying humility and continued learning.
